title: Open Data Contract Standard (ODCS)
description: An open data contract specification to establish agreement between data producers and consumers.

version.description: Current version of the data contract.

kind.description: The kind of file this is. Valid value is `DataContract`.

apiVersion.description: Version of the standard used to build data contract. Default value is v3.0.1.

id.description: A unique identifier used to reduce the risk of dataset name collisions, such as a UUID.

tenant.description: Indicates the property the data is primarily associated with. Value is case insensitive.

servers.description: List of servers where the datasets reside.

dataProduct.description: The name of the data product.

description.description: High level description of the dataset.

domain.description: Name of the logical data domain.

schema.description: A list of elements within the schema to be cataloged.

roles.description: A list of roles that will provide user access to the dataset.

slaDefaultElement.description: Element (using the element path notation) to do the checks on.

slaProperties.description: A list of key/value pairs for SLA specific properties. There is no limit on the type of properties (more details to come).

contractCreatedTs.description: Timestamp in UTC of when the data contract was created.

Server.description: Data source details of where data is physically stored.

roles.description: List of roles that have access to the server.

stagingDir.description: Amazon Athena automatically stores query results and metadata information for each query that runs in a query result location that you can specify in Amazon S3.

schema.description: Identify the schema in the data source in which your tables exist.

catalog.description: Identify the name of the Data Source, also referred to as a Catalog.

regionName.description: The region your AWS account uses.

location.description: Fully qualified path to Azure Blob Storage or Azure Data Lake Storage (ADLS), supports globs.

delimiter.description: Only for format = json. How multiple json documents are delimited within one file

host.description: The host of the ClickHouse server.

port.description: The port to the ClickHouse server.

catalog.description: The name of the Hive or Unity catalog

schema.description: The schema name in the catalog

host.description: The host of the Denodo server.

port.description: The port of the Denodo server.

host.description: The host of the Dremio server.

port.description: The port of the Dremio server.

location.description: The AWS S3 path. Must be in the form of a URL.

host.description: The host of the Google Cloud Sql server.

port.description: The port of the Google Cloud Sql server.

host.description: The host of the IBM DB2 server.

port.description: The port of the IBM DB2 server.

host.description: The host to the Informix server.

port.description: The port to the Informix server. Defaults to 9088.

path.description: Relative or absolute path to the data file(s).

port.description: Port to the server. No default value is assumed for custom servers.

warehouse.description: Name of the cluster or warehouse.

host.description: The bootstrap server of the kafka cluster.

path.description: The relative or absolute path to the data file(s).

host.description: The host of the MySql server.

port.description: The port of the MySql server.

host.description: The host to the oracle server

port.description: The port to the oracle server.

host.description: The host to the Postgres server

port.description: The port to the Postgres server.

schema.description: The name of the schema in the database.

host.description: The host to the Presto server
An optional string describing the server.

account.description: The account used by the server.

endpointUrl.description: The server endpoint for S3-compatible servers.

delimiter.description: Only for format = json. How multiple json documents are delimited within one file
Only for format = json. How multiple json documents are delimited within one file

host.description: The host to the Snowflake server

port.description: The port to the Snowflake server.

account.description: The Snowflake account used by the server.

warehouse.description: The name of the cluster of resources that is a Snowflake virtual warehouse.

host.description: The host to the database server

port.description: The port to the database server.

schema.description: The name of the schema in the database.

host.description: The host of the Synapse server.

port.description: The port of the Synapse server.

schema.description: The name of the schema in the database.

host.description: The host of the Vertica server.

port.description: The port of the Vertica server.

physicalType.description: The physical element data type in the data source.

businessName.description: The business name of the element.

dataGranularityDescription.description: Granular level of the data in the object.

properties.description: A list of properties for the object.

primaryKey.description: Boolean value specifying whether the element is primary or not. Default is false.

primaryKeyPosition.description: If element is a primary key, the position of the primary key element. Starts from 1. Example of `account_id, name` being primary key columns, `account_id` has primaryKeyPosition 1 and `name` primaryKeyPosition 2. Default to -1.

logicalTypeOptions.description: Additional optional metadata to describe the logical type.

physicalType.description: The physical element data type in the data source. For example, VARCHAR(2), DOUBLE, INT.

required.description: Indicates if the element may contain Null values; possible values are true and false. Default is false.

unique.description: Indicates if the element contains unique values; possible values are true and false. Default is false.

partitioned.description: Indicates if the element is partitioned; possible values are true and false.

partitionKeyPosition.description: If element is used for partitioning, the position of the partition element. Starts from 1. Example of `country, year` being partition columns, `country` has partitionKeyPosition 1 and `year` partitionKeyPosition 2. Default to -1.

classification.description: Can be anything, like confidential, restricted, and public to more advanced categorization. Some companies like PayPal, use data classification indicating the class of data in the element; expected values are 1, 2, 3, 4, or 5.

encryptedName.description: The element name within the dataset that contains the encrypted element value. For example, unencrypted element `email_address` might have an encryptedName of `email_address_encrypt`.

transformSourceObjects.description: List of objects in the data source used in the transformation.

transformLogic.description: Logic used in the element transformation.

transformDescription.description: Describes the transform logic in very simple terms.

criticalDataElement.description: True or false indicator; If element is considered a critical data element (CDE) then true else false.

pattern.description: Regular expression pattern to define valid value. Follows regular expression syntax from ECMA-262 (https://262.ecma-international.org/5.1/#sec-15.10.1).

format.description: Provides extra context about what format the string follows.
Format of the date. Follows the format as prescribed by [JDK DateTimeFormatter](https://docs.oracle.com/javase/8/docs/api/java/time/format/DateTimeFormatter.html). For example, format 'yyyy-MM-dd'.

exclusiveMaximum.description: If set to true, all values are strictly less than the maximum value (values < maximum). Otherwise, less than or equal to the maximum value (values <= maximum).

maximum.description: All date values are less than or equal to this value (values <= maximum).

exclusiveMinimum.description: If set to true, all values are strictly greater than the minimum value (values > minimum). Otherwise, greater than or equal to the minimum value (values >= minimum).

minimum.description: All date values are greater than or equal to this value (values >= minimum).

multipleOf.description: Values must be multiples of this number. For example, multiple of 5 has valid values 0, 5, 10, -5.

maximum.description: All values are less than or equal to this value (values <= maximum).

exclusiveMaximum.description: If set to true, all values are strictly less than the maximum value (values < maximum). Otherwise, less than or equal to the maximum value (values <= maximum).

minimum.description: All values are greater than or equal to this value (values >= minimum).

exclusiveMinimum.description: If set to true, all values are strictly greater than the minimum value (values > minimum). Otherwise, greater than or equal to the minimum value (values >= minimum).

format.description: Format of the value in terms of how many bits of space it can use and whether it is signed or unsigned (follows the Rust integer types).

multipleOf.description: Values must be multiples of this number. For example, multiple of 5 has valid values 0, 5, 10, -5.

maximum.description: All values are less than or equal to this value (values <= maximum).

exclusiveMaximum.description: If set to true, all values are strictly less than the maximum value (values < maximum). Otherwise, less than or equal to the maximum value (values <= maximum).

minimum.description: All values are greater than or equal to this value (values >= minimum).

exclusiveMinimum.description: If set to true, all values are strictly greater than the minimum value (values > minimum). Otherwise, greater than or equal to the minimum value (values >= minimum).

format.description: Format of the value in terms of how many bits of space it can use (follows the Rust float types).

required.description: Property names that are required to exist in the object.

properties.description: A list of properties for the object.

uniqueItems.description: If set to true, all items in the array are unique.

items.description: List of items in an array (only applicable when `logicalType: array`).

properties.description: A list of properties for the object.

Tags.description: A list of tags that may be assigned to the elements (object or property); the tags keyword may appear at any level. Tags may be used to better categorize an element. For example, `finance`, `sensitive`, `employee_record`.

customProperties.description: Additional properties required for rule execution.

description.description: Describe the quality check to be completed.

dimension.description: The key performance indicator (KPI) or dimension for data quality.

name.description: Name of the data quality check.

scheduler.description: The name or type of scheduler used to start the data quality check.

severity.description: The severance of the quality rule.

type.description: The type of quality check. 'text' is human-readable text that describes the quality of the data. 'library' is a set of maintained predefined quality attributes such as row count or unique. 'sql' is an individual SQL query that returns a value that can be compared. 'custom' is quality attributes that are vendor-specific, such as Soda or Great Expectations.

unit.description: Unit the rule is using, popular values are `rows` or `percent`, but any value is allowed.

DataQualityChecks.description: Data quality rules with all the relevant information for rule setup and execution.

rule.description: Define a data quality check based on the predefined rules as per ODCS.

mustBe.description: Must be equal to the value to be valid. When using numbers, it is equivalent to '='.

mustNotBe.description: Must not be equal to the value to be valid. When using numbers, it is equivalent to '!='.

mustBeGreaterThan.description: Must be greater than the value to be valid. It is equivalent to '>'.

mustBeGreaterOrEqualTo.description: Must be greater than or equal to the value to be valid. It is equivalent to '>='.

mustBeLessThan.description: Must be less than the value to be valid. It is equivalent to '<'.

mustBeLessOrEqualTo.description: Must be less than or equal to the value to be valid. It is equivalent to '<='.

mustBeBetween.description: Must be between the two numbers to be valid. Smallest number first in the array.

mustNotBeBetween.description: Must not be between the two numbers to be valid. Smallest number first in the array.

query.description: Query string that adheres to the dialect of the provided server.
examples: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM ${table} WHERE ${column} IS NOT NULL

engine.description: Name of the engine which executes the data quality checks.

AuthoritativeDefinitions.description: List of links to sources that provide more details on the dataset; examples would be a link to an external definition, a training video, a git repo, data catalog, or another tool. Authoritative definitions follow the same structure in the standard.

type.description: Type of definition for authority: v2.3 adds standard values: `businessDefinition`, `transformationImplementation`, `videoTutorial`, `tutorial`, and `implementation`.

url.description: Access URL using normal [URL scheme](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/URL#Syntax) (https, mailto, etc.).

description.description: Description of the channel, free text.

tool.description: Name of the tool, value can be `email`, `slack`, `teams`, `discord`, `ticket`, or `other`.

invitationUrl.description: Some tools uses invitation URL for requesting or subscribing. Follows the [URL scheme](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/URL#Syntax).

priceAmount.description: Subscription price per unit of measure in `priceUnit`.

priceCurrency.description: Currency of the subscription price in `price.priceAmount`.

priceUnit.description: The unit of measure for calculating cost. Examples megabyte, gigabyte.

role.description: The user's job role; Examples might be owner, data steward. There is no limit on the role.

dateIn.description: The date when the user joined the team.

dateOut.description: The date when the user ceased to be part of the team.

replacedByUsername.description: The username of the user who replaced the previous user.

role.description: Name of the IAM role that provides access to the dataset.

description.description: Description of the IAM role and its permissions.

access.description: The type of access provided by the IAM role.

firstLevelApprovers.description: The name(s) of the first-level approver(s) of the role.

secondLevelApprovers.description: The name(s) of the second-level approver(s) of the role.

property.description: Specific property in SLA, check the periodic table. May requires units (more details to come).

value.description: Agreement value. The label will change based on the property itself.

valueExt.description: Extended agreement value. The label will change based on the property itself.

unit.description: **d**, day, days for days; **y**, yr, years for years, etc. Units use the ISO standard.

element.description: Element(s) to check on. Multiple elements should be extremely rare and, if so, separated by commas.

driver.description: Describes the importance of the SLA from the list of: `regulatory`, `analytics`, or `operational`.

CustomProperties.description: A list of key/value pairs for custom properties.

property.description: The name of the key. Names should be in camel casethe same as if they were permanent properties in the contract.
